intro: Cuviera acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered cuviera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cuviera acutiflora is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
